DataElement.preferredName: Physical Examination Test Body System Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The component consisting of one or all members of an organ system or medical topic under examination.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Physical Exam Domain Physical Examination Test
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to physical exam._A character or string that represents the full name of the physical examination assessment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to physical exam.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to physical exam.

Property.preferredDefinition: A character or string that represents the full name of the physical examination assessment.

Concepts.definition: A character or string that represents the full name of the physical examination assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Elevated to Standard per governance approval by RA. 2021-6-11 ak 12/18/18 TT released/MC. Created as part of the CDISC mapping task_ghd_08.27.18

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An enumerated list of body or organ systems, suitable for a Review of Systems (ROS) or evaluation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Protected against infectious disease by either specific or non-specific mechanisms. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: Protected against infectious disease by either specific or non-specific mechanisms.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: HEENT is the Head, Ears, Eyes, Nose and Throat, and is referred to as a body system on a physical or medical examination. The term is typically used as 'HEENT' in a physician or caregiver notes.

Concepts.longName: Head, Ears, Eyes, Nose and Throat
Concepts.definition: HEENT is the Head, Ears, Eyes, Nose and Throat, and is referred to as a body system on a physical or medical examination.  The term is typically used as 'HEENT' in a physician or caregiver notes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The region that connects the head to the rest of the body.

Concepts.definition: The region that connects the head to the rest of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to respiration.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to respiration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to the heart and the blood vessels or the circulation.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the heart and the blood vessels or the circulation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The system that includes the esophagus, stomach, small and large intestine, anus, liver, biliary tract, and pancreas.

Concepts.definition: The system that includes the esophagus, stomach, small and large intestine, anus, liver, biliary tract, and pancreas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having to do with muscles, bones, and cartilage.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the muscles and skeleton.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The enveloping membrane of the body; includes, in addition to the epidermis and dermis, all of the derivatives of the epidermis, e.g., hairs, nails, sudoriferous and sebaceous glands, and mammary glands.

Concepts.definition: The enveloping membrane of the body; includes, in addition to the epidermis and dermis, all the derivatives of the epidermis, e.g., hairs, nails, sudoriferous and sebaceous glands.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The bodily system of organs and tissues, primarily the bone marrow, spleen, tonsils, and lymph nodes, involved in the production of blood considered together with the interconnected system of spaces and vessels between body tissues and organs by which lymph circulates throughout the body.

Concepts.definition: The bodily system of organs and tissues, primarily the bone marrow, spleen, tonsils, and lymph nodes, involved in the production of blood considered together with the interconnected system of spaces and vessels between body tissues and organs by which lymph circulates throughout the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The system of glands that release their secretions (hormones) directly into the circulatory system. In addition to the ENDOCRINE GLANDS, included are the CHROMAFFIN SYSTEM and the NEUROSECRETORY SYSTEMS.

Concepts.definition: Collective designation for those tissues capable of secreting hormones.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: URINARY

Concepts.definition: Urinary; of or relating to urine, of or relating to the urinary system, or of or relating to the function or production or secretion of urine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The external sex organs.

Concepts.definition: The external sex organs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The structure of the vertebrate skeleton supporting the lower limbs in humans and the hind limbs or corresponding parts in other vertebrates.

Concepts.definition: The bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: That portion of the body that lies between the thorax and the pelvis.

Concepts.definition: The cavity located between the lungs and pelvis. It contains the lower esophagus, stomach, pancreas, intestines, liver, gallbladder and spleen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (noor-uh-LOJ-ik) Having to do with nerves or the nervous system.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to nerves or the nervous system.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having to do with how the mind works and how thoughts and feelings affect behavior.: The entire nerve apparatus, composed of a central part, the brain and spinal cord, and a peripheral part, the cranial and spinal nerves, autonomic ganglia, and plexuses.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with how the mind works and how thoughts and feelings affect behavior.
The entire nerve apparatus, composed of a central part, the brain and spinal cord, and a peripheral part, the cranial and spinal nerves, autonomic ganglia, and plexuses.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Refers to the liver.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to, affecting, or associated with the liver.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ that produces lymphocytes, filters the blood, stores blood cells, and destroys those that are aging. It is located on the left side of the abdomen near the stomach. (OCC)

Concepts.definition: An organ that is part of the hematopoietic and immune systems. It is composed of the white pulp and the red pulp and is surrounded by a capsule. It is located in the left hypochondriac region. Its functions include lymphocyte production, blood cell storage, and blood cell destruction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to the lungs.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the lungs as the intended site of administration, where the pharmaceutical product is administered, usually by inhalation, for local action in the lower respiratory tract or for systemic action after absorption via the lower respiratory tract.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or pertaining to the kidney.

Concepts.definition: Of or pertaining to the kidney.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.: The bodily system of organs and tissues, primarily the bone marrow, spleen, tonsils, and lymph nodes, involved in the production of blood.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.
The bodily system of organs and tissues, primarily the bone marrow, spleen, tonsils, and lymph nodes, involved in the production of blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Related to the rectum

Concepts.definition: Of or pertaining to the rectum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An important aggregate factor in epidemiological studies of women's health. The concept usually includes the number and timing of pregnancies and their outcomes, the incidence of breast feeding, and may include age of menarche and menopause, regularity of menstruation, fertility, gynecological or obstetric problems, or contraceptive usage.

Concepts.definition: An account of all reproductive events and problems a person has experienced. An important aggregate factor in epidemiological studies of women's health.  The concept usually includes the number and timing of pregnancies and their outcomes, the incidence of breast feeding, and may include age of menarche and menopause, regularity of menstruation, fertility, gynecological or obstetric problems, or contraceptive usage.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A group of symptoms that affect an individual's general well being. Representative examples include fever, chills, fatigue, weakness, and weight loss.

Concepts.definition: A group of symptoms that affect an individual's general well being. Representative examples include fever, chills, fatigue, weakness, and weight loss.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Removed special characters for MDR data migration. 3.5.20 mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Body limbs, consisting of right upper and lower (arm and leg) and left upper and lower (arm and leg).

Concepts.definition: Body limbs, consisting of right upper and lower (arm and leg) and left upper and lower (arm and leg). (CADSR)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The enveloping membrane of the body; includes, in addition to the epidermis and dermis, all the derivatives of the epidermis, e.g., hairs, nails, sudoriferous and sebaceous glands.

Concepts.definition: The enveloping membrane of the body; includes, in addition to the epidermis and dermis, all the derivatives of the epidermis, e.g., hairs, nails, sudoriferous and sebaceous glands.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood vessel located in the following sites: upper extremities, lower extremities, lower abdomen, head, or neck.: The cardiovascular and lymphatic systems, collectively.

Concepts.definition: A blood vessel located in the following sites: upper extremities, lower extremities, lower abdomen, head, or neck.
The cardiovascular and lymphatic systems, collectively.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Replaced NCIm concept with NCIt. mc 7/2/21

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subject's past experiences related to the receipt of blood, WBC, platelets, and/or other blood components.

Concepts.definition: An account of all experiences related to the receipt of blood, WBC, platelets, and/or other blood components.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A local or general reaction of an organism following contact with a specific allergen to which it has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized.

Concepts.definition: An immune response that occurs following exposure to an innocuous antigen, but that does not require the presence of preformed antibodies to the antigen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The result of observation and overall assessment of a subject's outward aspect including appearance and movements; for example, in a human newborn general appearance includes skin color and tone, range of motion, and spontaneous movements.

Concepts.definition: The result of observation and overall assessment of a subject's outward aspect including appearance and movements; for example, in a human newborn general appearance includes skin color and tone, range of motion, and spontaneous movements.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The body system that includes all organs involved in reproduction and in the formation and voidance of urine.

Concepts.definition: The body system that includes all organs involved in reproduction and in the formation and voidance of urine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The main information-processing organs of the nervous system, consisting of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

Concepts.definition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The entire physical structure of an organism.  It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.

Concepts.definition: The entire physical structure of an organism. It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.

Concepts.definition: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition with most recent NCIt version. mc 2/15/13

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A category of psychiatric disorders which include disorders related to the taking of a drug of abuse (including alcohol, prescribed medications and recreational drugs).

Concepts.definition: A category of psychiatric disorders which include disorders related to the taking of a drug of abuse (including alcohol, prescribed medications and recreational drugs).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The overall state of an individual's psychologic constitution.

Concepts.definition: The overall state of an individual's psychologic constitution.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Replaced NCIm concept with NCIt. mc 7/2/21

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Collective designation for those tissues capable of secreting hormones.

Concepts.definition: Collective designation for those tissues capable of secreting hormones.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The body region composed of the vulva and vagina.

Concepts.definition: The body region composed of the vulva and vagina.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Widespread; broadly dispersed.

Concepts.definition: Widespread, broadly dispersed, common.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

Concepts.definition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 1 - SOC  V 25.1

Concepts.definition: 1 - SOC  V 25.1

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: New version created. Values are compliant with NCI CTMS instructions v.3.12 October 2003.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 2002895 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. ghd
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 12/8/2023: AQT is updated per caDSR0003171. the AQT isn't used on any forms. wz
